means: 使抽搐，使剧烈震动( convulse的过去式 )

sentence.Network_en: Olivia's face convulsed in a series of twitches.
sentence.Network_cn: 奥利维娅的脸上一阵抽搐。
剧烈的颤抖使他抽搐不已。

sentence.Network_en: His face was convulsed with rage.

PerfectNetExp.abs: His joke had us convulsed with laughter ., 他的笑话逗得我们前仰后合地大笑起来.
ugly Lin Wudi is elected the most convulsed character of the year . since there are so many convulsed spot in it , why do people like it that much ?“丑女”林无敌被评为年度最雷人角色，那么既然雷点那么多，大家为什么还都那么喜欢看？
The country was convulsed with civil war ., 该国因内战而动荡不安.
buildings and streets convulsed by the detonation of a bomb ;, 因炸弹爆炸而剧烈震动的楼房和街道;

list.abs: 热痉挛(febrile convulsion)二、 诊断依据  1. 发热、咳嗽2天。
热性惊厥(febrile convulsion)，由于绝大多数患儿是在体温突然和显著增高时发作，国内习惯使用高热惊厥名称。本病是婴幼儿最常见 …
tonic contraction 紧张性收缩tonic convulsion 强直性抽搐tonic discharge pattern 紧张性放射类型紧张性放射类型.
医学及制药专业词汇 - 翻译学习资料区大家论坛 ... clone 细胞系 clonic convulsion 阵挛性惊厥 clonic spasm 阵挛性惊厥.
convulsive reflex 痉挛反射convulsive therapy 惊厥疗法convulsive tic 面肌抽搐

entry.tran: （使）(身体)剧烈抖动;(使)抽搐;(使)痉挛
entry.def: If someone convulses or if they are convulsed by or with something, their body moves suddenly in an uncontrolled way.

example.ex: Olivia's face convulsed in a series of twitches...
example.tran: 奥利维娅的脸上一阵抽搐。

example.ex: He let out a cry that convulsed his bulky frame and jerked his arm...
example.tran: 他大叫一声，高大的身躯剧烈地抖了一下，手臂也突然一哆嗦。

auth_sentence.content: Suddenly a blind, shattering fury convulsed him.
auth_sentence.res_content: Suddenly a blind, shattering fury convulsed him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Suddenly a blind, shattering fury convulsed him.

auth_sentence.content: Mortar and rocket fire has convulsed their once-tranquil district in the past few weeks.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mortar and rocket fire has convulsed their once-tranquil district in the past few weeks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mortar and rocket fire has convulsed their once-tranquil district in the past few weeks.

auth_sentence.content: But in the confused, edgy atmosphere of a city convulsed by riot, all groups seemed suspicious, treacherous.
auth_sentence.res_content: But in the confused, edgy atmosphere of a city convulsed by riot, all groups seemed suspicious, treacherous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But in the confused, edgy atmosphere of a city convulsed by riot, all groups seemed suspicious, treacherous.
